not responding as weakness. He wants to be Putin, and he will do everything he can to steal the midterms. And we are sending a message that we won't go down without a fight. Now, you may believe that Dems are a lock in the midterms. You may also think that (2/6)

if Trump is able to steal the midterms, we are in a lot bigger trouble than Va Redistricting. But we don't know what the future holds. All we have is this moment, and how are we going to respond? The last thing I'll add is if you're shitposting that Dems are (3/6)

Potomal Local News:
" Breaking: Recount underway in Woodbridge Democratic caucus
The Prince William County Democratic Committee tells Potomac Local it is conducting a recount following Saturday’s Democratic caucus to select a nominee for the Woodbridge District supervisor seat.
Unofficial results earlier Saturday showed Muhammed “Sef” Casim narrowly leading Pamela G. Montgomery, but party officials say results are not final and have not been certified.
The winner will face Republican Jennie LaCroix in the March 10 special election. We’ll update as soon as official results are released. "

images.alt: Just a quick update from the Twin Cities. (Please forgive the unsolicited message). THINGS ARE NOT BETTER IN MINNEAPOLIS. The media is mostly moving on, Trump is focused on other stuff, BUT NOTHING HAS CHANGED ON THE GROUND. More than 2,000 DHS thugs continue to roam the streets, abducting people 24/7, assaulting legal observers with impunity, and routinely denying 1st, 4th, and 5th amendment rights. Drones and helicopters are overhead every day. Hundreds and hundreds of terrified families have not left their homes since mid-December ... relying on the community to bring them food and help with rent and other necessities. (Those people are NOT violent drug cartel sex offending murderers, as DHS would tell you. Most are legal residents or citizens.)  If anything, things have just become more stressful and intractable (think trench warfare as a suitable metaphor): The resistance is better organized and numerous, but DHS has become more clever and better at disguise... and the county sheriff's office is increasingly supporting them . Do not let anyone tell you that Homans (the new person in charge of the occupation) is making anything better. Do not let anyone tell you that 700 ICE agents leaving the city has made much of a difference; the remaining force (again, ~2,000) is still larger than the entire city's police force (which is legally unable to do anything). Please call your congressional reps ... especially if there is any chance the administration might listen to them.

Thank you!
this guy sounds like a real piece of shit

images.alt:
Senior management at the Post were livid when they discovered that Lewis was attending festivities around the Super Bowl in San Francisco around the time of the news of the job cuts. It came off as “callous”, said a newsroom source, adding that “the Super Bowl thing was the last straw”.

“Bezos lost patience after the Super Bowl thing”, the source added.

Lewis was criticised in the newsroom last month for not offering words of public support after a reporter’s home was searched by FBI agents, which was seen as a further escalation of President Donald Trump’s attacks on the media. “We’re under siege from the FBI and the Pentagon and he just walled himself off,” the person said. 

The sense that Lewis had lost the newsroom only increased on the day the job cuts were announced. “There was no communication from him about buyouts,” the person added. “He didn’t put out a statement. Senior editorial leadership was furious.”

Exclusive: Site takes a cut of subscriptions to content that promotes far-right ideology, white supremacy and antisemitism

The global publishing platform Substack is generating revenue from newsletters that promote virulent Nazi ideology, white supremacy and antisemitism, a Guardian investigation has found.

The platform, which says it has about 50 million users worldwide, allows members of the public to self-publish articles and charge for premium content. Substack takes about 10% of the revenue the newsletters make. About 5 million people pay for access to newsletters on its platform. Continue reading...

Tweet by Doug Lewin: "Two new solar records today in Texas/ERCOT:
 
🏆 first time over 30,000 megawatts
☀️first time over 58% of supply

Quite the progression:
2015: 500 megawatts
2017: 1,000 megawatts
2021: 5,000 megawatts
2022: 10,000 megawatts
2024: 15,000 megawatts
Feb. 2026: 30,000 megawatts!!"

record.text: So, solar in "red" Texas is booming, hitting 30 GW - up 3x since '22, 6x since '21, 30x since '17, 60x since '15. Solar in Virginia's increasing too, but not nearly as fast (added 1.5 GW in '24 to reach 6.8 GW). Let's crank it up!   bluevirginia.us/2026/02/satu... h/t @douglewin.bsky.social
